name: Masters of the Night-Wind
desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Mictlan. They are famous for their predictions and rituals to amplify the ability to communicate with the Night Kingdom and the Wayob.

imgDesc.text: Living with the Iktomisaurs, this is where the Masters of the Night-Wind, most mysterious of the six major tribes of Natlan, call home. It is said that at night, the members of the tribe and their Saurians use glowing patterns to listen to the echoes of the silent kingdom of the night.

galleryCharacter.key: Ceremonial Site Lost in Night's Dim Light

imgDesc.text: After passing the test, those members of the Masters of the Night-Wind who are considered to be Spiritspeakers train here from a very young age, learning how to correctly interpret the words of the Nightsouls.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>November 10, 2024</color>
Hello, Traveler~
Head west from the Stadium of the Sacred Flame and pass through the towering outer wall, there you will find a mysterious tribe — the Masters of the Night-Wind. Let us read this Adventure Guide and together remove the veil of secrecy that shrouds the Masters of the Night-Wind~

customize.name: Sanhaj
customize.desc: The great priest of the Masters of the Night-Wind and Border Master, who bore the Ancient NameHe died in the Battle of the Mare Jivari 500 years ago.

customize.text:
A legendary Border Master of the Masters of the Night-Wind whose astonishing magic once repelled the dark cataclysm during the Battle of the Mare Jivari. His companion was Mahamba, the most enigmatic of the Iktomisaurs.
Ayizu
Chief of the Masters of the Night-Wind, who fought alongside

customize.name: Il Capitano
customize.desc: The First of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers and the Sentinel Knight of Khaenri'ah. His real name is Thrain.

customize.text: 500 years ago. Although many people viewed

as the cause of the tragedy, Ayizu was kind to Thrain and helped him in his time of need. In his final moments, Ayizu told the Sentinel Knight about the Gnosis' ability to reconstruct the Ley Lines.
Liriwu
A young mystic who went to

customize.name: Ochkanatlan
customize.desc: In order to pursue the great dream in the morning mist and sea of clouds, the warriors who soared the skies never rested for a moment.

customize.text:
along with the Adventurers' group.
Kuntur
Son of Qoyllor who lived on the star and a mortal, Ukuku. He is also known as "Kuntur, Unloved of the Sun."
Huitzilin
Huitzilin was a great shaman and Citlali's friend, who lived 200 years ago. She is famous for the Battle of Seven Colors, in which she used a mysterious color to construct a maze and trap the enemies inside.

customize.name: Biram
customize.desc: Chief of the Masters of the Night-Wind.

customize.name: Citlali
customize.desc: The great shaman from the Masters of the Night-Wind, the universally-revered Granny Itztli.

customize.text:
Chief Priestess and tribal elder, who has lived for over 200 years. She created the Spiritspeaker Stone — an artifact that can be used to communicate with the Wayob.
Great Tlapopoctiztetl
Iktomisaur Elder, a living totem among the Masters of the Night-Wind. He was Huitzilin's companion under the name Claw.

customize.name: Ororon
customize.desc: A young man from the Masters of the Night-Wind who instead lives in the wild alongside all manner of life.

customize.text:
A hero of the Masters of the Night Wind, who has been acknowledged by his Ancient Name
Chikya
Member of the tribe seeking for "legendary elixir that heals all wounds."

customize.name: Tezcatepetonco Range
customize.desc: Living with the Iktomisaurs, this is where the Masters of the Night-Wind, most mysterious of the six major tribes of Natlan, call home. It is said that at night, the members of the tribe and their Saurians use glowing patterns to listen to the echoes of the silent kingdom of the night.

customize.name: Iktomisaurus Chick
customize.desc:
A young Iktomisaur with a keen sense of perception.
It has yet to grow its full plumage and may even appear a little slow on the uptake. It is said that among the Saurians that now live, Iktomisaurs not only have the longest lifespans, but spend the longest time as juveniles too. They possess the capacity to communicate with the Night Kingdom or Wayob, though it may take many years before the young Saurians can fully comprehend this.

customize.name: Iktomisaurus
customize.desc:
Able to use their plumage for leaping, Iktomisaurs are also the only type of Saurian to have grasped how to enter the "Spiritspeaker" state.
According to legend, their ancestors did not have a physical form, and instead could drift like spirits between reality and the spiritual realm, manifesting themselves through the darkness of night. Some also say that the first Iktomisaur to emerge from the Night Kingdom was not actually a true Saurian, but rather a unique race distinct from ordinary Saurians.

customize.name: Flute of Ezpitzal
customize.desc: A peculiarly shaped jade longsword that has been passed down amongst the Masters of the Night-Wind as a "priestly flute."

customize.name: Calamity of Eshu
customize.desc: A ceremonial blade forged by Sanhaj, the great high priest of the Masters of the Night-Wind. In tales of bygone days, Sanhaj could use this curved blade to perform rituals, blurring the boundary between the Night Kingdom and the present world.

customize.name: Talking Stick
customize.desc: Most people will find this obsidian-inlaid club quite convincing indeed.

customize.name: Starcaller's Watch
customize.desc: A statue carved in the shape of an eagle, a sacred relic of the Masters of the Night-Wind that has been passed down from generation to generation.

customize.name: Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City
The Tale of Qoyllor and Ukuku
Masters of the Night-Wind Reputation EXP
customize.desc: Increases your Tribe Reputation Lv. (Masters of the Night-Wind)

customize.name: Purple Obsidian Ring
customize.desc: An obsidian ring with engraved patterns styled like those of the Masters of the Night-Wind. It is an ancient medium by which the tribe established contact with the deep night. Perhaps its strength can allow you to cross the boundary between this place and a certain other location...
